intro: Microsisymbrium qingshuiheense, commonly known as the Qingshuihe endemic legume, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, typically found in alpine meadows. It plays a significant role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil nitrogen fixation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
